content.text:
# Draft:High School Republican National Federation

The High School Republican National Federation was started in 2022 as a student-led alternative to Teen Age Republicans. The largest High School Republican chapters are in Washington D.C., Oregon, and Texas. According to the High School Republican National Federation's website, they are "committed to fostering political engagement and leadership skills among young conservatives.

Initiatives
In 2025, the High School Republican National Federation held a Virtual Prayer Vigil in the aftermath of the assassination of Charlie Kirk. After the assassination of Charlie Kirk, National Communications Director Fenner Parker was quoted in Newsweek as saying, "His death is not in vain; it will serve as a rallying cry for our generation to carry forward his vision with unrelenting passion." After the Virtual Prayer Vigil concluded, Executive Director Connor McFarland and Chairman David Sharyan were quoted in the New York Times describing the current political climate. Currently, the High School Republican National Federation is focused on expansion and outreach to students.
